summary: Used 2 positive examples and 2 negative examples.

results.thoughts: The scan shows a large, round lesion with significant contrast enhancement in the right frontal region. This suggests a tumor.
The scan reveals a large, irregular lesion in the right parietal region. The abnormal density and shape suggest the presence of a tumor.
The brain tissue appears symmetrical and within normal limits. No masses or lesions are observed. The ventricles are normal in size. No evidence of a tumor.
The brain tissue appears normal. I see no irregular masses or unusual enhancement. The anatomical structures seem well-defined.
The brain image shows normal anatomical structures. There are no signs of tumors or abnormal growths.

The MRI scan shows multiple areas of increased signal intensity scattered throughout the white matter. While these findings are abnormal, they do not appear to be a single, cohesive mass indicative of a tumor. Instead, they suggest a demyelinating or inflammatory process. The appearance is not characteristic of a brain tumor. The scattered locations of the signal intensity could correspond to other non-tumor related conditions.
The scan reveals a large, irregular lesion in the right frontal region. The mass effect suggests the presence of a tumor.

The scan reveals an irregular lesion with heterogeneous signal intensity in the right temporal region. The lesion appears to be distorting the surrounding brain tissue. This abnormal finding suggests the presence of a tumor.
